TITLE: Configuring Remote Application with Module Federation in Vite
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for a remote Vite application that exposes components through Module Federation. It defines the federation plugin with name, filename, exposed components, and shared dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/module-federation/vite/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { defineConfig } from 'vite';
import { federation } from '@module-federation/vite'; ðŸ‘ˆ

export default defineConfig({
  [...]
  plugins: [
    [...]
    federation({ ðŸ‘ˆ
      name: "remote",
      filename: "remoteEntry.js",
      exposes: {
        "./remote-app": "./src/App.vue",
      },
      shared: ["vue"],
    }),
  ],
  server: {
    origin: "http://localhost:{Your port}"
  },
  // Do you need to support build targets lower than chrome89?
  // You can use 'vite-plugin-top-level-await' plugin for that.
  build: {
    target: 'chrome89',
  },
  [...]
});
```

TITLE: Configuring Host Application with Module Federation in Vite
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for a host Vite application that consumes remote components through Module Federation. It defines the federation plugin with name, remotes specification, shared dependencies, and other settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/module-federation/vite/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { defineConfig } from 'vite';
import { federation } from '@module-federation/vite'; ðŸ‘ˆ

export default defineConfig({
  [...]
  plugins: [
    [...]
    federation({ ðŸ‘ˆ
      name: "host",
      remotes: {
        remote: {
          type: "module",
          name: "remote",
          entry: "https://[...]/remoteEntry.js",
          entryGlobalName: "remote",
          shareScope: "default",
        },
      },
      filename: "remoteEntry.js",
      shared: ["vue"],
    }),
  ],
  server: {
    origin: "http://localhost:{Your port}"
  },
  // Do you need to support build targets lower than chrome89?
  // You can use 'vite-plugin-top-level-await' plugin for that.
  build: {
    target: 'chrome89',
  },
  [...]
});
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/module-federation/vite/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
<script setup lang="ts">
import { defineAsyncComponent } from "vue";
const RemoteMFE = defineAsyncComponent( ðŸ‘ˆ
  () => import("remote/remote-app")

</script>

<template>
  <RemoteMFE v-if="!!RemoteMFE" /> ðŸ‘ˆ
```

TITLE: Configuring Module Federation for Remote Application in Vite
DESCRIPTION: Vite configuration for the remote application that exposes modules to be consumed by the host. This setup defines the components to be exposed and configures shared dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/module-federation/vite/blob/main/examples/nuxt-vite/nuxt-remote/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
// vite.config.js
import { defineConfig } from 'vite'
import vue from '@vitejs/plugin-vue'
import federation from '@originjs/vite-plugin-federation'

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [
    vue(),
    federation({
      name: 'remote-app',
      filename: 'remoteEntry.js',
      exposes: {
        './Button': './src/components/Button.vue',
        './Modal': './src/components/Modal.vue',
        './utils': './src/utils.js'
      },
      shared: ['vue']
    })
  ],
})
```

TITLE: Configuring Module Federation for Host Application in Vite
DESCRIPTION: Vite configuration for the host application that consumes remote modules. This setup defines the remote modules to be imported and configures the sharing of dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/module-federation/vite/blob/main/examples/nuxt-vite/nuxt-remote/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
// vite.config.js
import { defineConfig } from 'vite'
import vue from '@vitejs/plugin-vue'
import federation from '@originjs/vite-plugin-federation'

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [
    vue(),
    federation({
      name: 'host-app',
      remotes: {
        remote_app: 'http://localhost:5001/assets/remoteEntry.js',
      },
      shared: ['vue']
    })
  ],
})
```

TITLE: Running Multi-Bundler Example with Module Federation
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install dependencies, build the project, and run an example that demonstrates Module Federation working across multiple bundlers (Vite, Webpack, and Rspack).
SOURCE: https://github.com/module-federation/vite/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm install
pnpm run build
pnpm run multi-example
```

TITLE: Installing Module Federation Plugins for Vite
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the necessary module federation plugins using npm. This installs the vite plugin and the required types for implementing module federation in a Vite project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/module-federation/vite/blob/main/examples/nuxt-vite/nuxt-remote/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @originjs/vite-plugin-federation @types/node --save-dev
```
